commentary.text: Vijay on strike, Agarwal at the other end
Vinay Kumar to Vijay,1 leg bye,walks out first ball, Vinay nips it in from short of a length, it hits the pad high and rolls to the off side
Vinay Kumar to Agarwal, $$FOUR$$ ,shot, gets on his toes and punches this back of a length ball in the air just past point
Vinay Kumar to Agarwal, $$FOUR$$ ,length in to the pad now, and Agarwal steps down the track and turn it neatly through midwicket
Vinay Kumar to Agarwal,1 run,once again into leg stump, and he is fortunate to be taken only for one to short fine as Agarwal cannot get enough on it

Vinay Kumar to Vijay, $$OUT$$ ,trouble for Vijay, there is a direct hit, superb work from Pandey at backward point, Vijay had walked too far down the pitch after getting hit on the thigh pad with an incoming ball, Pandey swooped on the ball and found Vijay well short
DK in at no 3
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,no run,good one, this one goes away after drawing DK into a forward push, beaten by some margin
sridhar: "Pandey!!! What a fielder. Still remember a great catch he took in the Karnataka-Mumbai Ranji final some three years ago. Good to see him firing today. "
Morkel to Agarwal,2 wides,far, far down the leg side from Morne first up, fine effort from the keeper to get some glove on it
Morkel to Karthik,no run,Morne finds the radar now, hits his favoured back of a length, and it rears up at DK, fortunate not to edge it
Morkel to Karthik,no run,nothing shot, tries to belatedly guide it towards point, beaten by the pace and bounce
Morkel to Karthik, $$FOUR$$ ,connects alright this time, slightly fuller from Morne, DK comes forward and lifts it over covers
Morkel to Karthik,1 run,very tight single, short ball dropped in front of cover, Agarwal was gone in case of a direct hit
Morkel to Agarwal,no run,lunges forward and has a heave but is beaten by this pitched up ball
Morkel to Agarwal,1 run,short of a length into the pad and with one leg in the air, he tucks it to fine leg
Vinay Kumar to Agarwal,2 runs,width outside off, it is guided to third man's right, Narine scrambles to stop it

Vinay Kumar to Agarwal,5 runs,madness out there, Agarwal turns it to midwicket, he wants the single for about a few steps, then he doesn't, DK wants it some more, then he hesitates, decides to go for it, Agarwal has no choice, the captain has made it for him, the throw is way off target at the keeper's end, the man backing up follows up with a worse one at the bowler's end, and it runs all the way to the straight boundary
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,1 run
Vinay Kumar to Agarwal,1 run
Vinay Kumar to Karthik, $$FOUR$$ ,too short, too wide, he intentionally flays it in the air and comfortably clears cover
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,no run,walks out, but Vinay moves it in to the pad, and DK cannot get bat on it
Morkel to Agarwal, $$FOUR$$ ,that is as clean a hit as any, Agarwal has made some room outside leg stump, and blitzed this length delivery over mid off with a straight, high followthrough
Morkel to Agarwal,2 runs,now he moves across the stumps, and works this off the pad and wide of fine leg

Morkel to Agarwal,no run,they are running away to nowhere, Agarwal goes through with another punchy drive in the air, mid off is there, and had he hit, DK would have been out, he had wandered that far out
Morkel to Agarwal,no run,short and climbing outside off, left alone
Morkel to Agarwal,2 runs,he is hurried into an awkward attempt at a pull with this 140 kph short ball, but just manages to clear square leg

Morkel to Agarwal, $$OUT$$ ,not happening this time, Morne cranks it up to 147 kph on this short ball, Agarwal turns on one leg, trying to lift it over square leg, but he is not so lucky this time, loops straight to the man
Ross Taylor at No 4
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,2 runs,rides the bounce on this back of a length ball and guides it past point
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,no run,walks out to a good length ball, is too close to it, and can only knock it to point
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,1 run,leaves the crease once more, turns a length ball to wide mid on and is taking it easy on the single before he realises he has to hurry, makes it, throw misses anyway
Vinay Kumar to Taylor,no run,punches this good length ball to the bowler who parries it behind him
Vinay Kumar to Taylor,no run,squeezes a good length ball to covers
Vinay Kumar to Taylor,1 run,turns another length ball in front of mid on for one
Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor,1 run,taps a tossed up ball to the off side for a single
Shakib Al Hasan to Karthik,1 run,turned off the pad to deep midwicket
Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, $$FOUR$$ ,Taylor with the slog sweep, an almighty top edge of a slog sweep, no one at deep square leg, and it plonks down near the rope and rolls into it
Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor,no run,waits on this one outside off and decides to cut quite late, hits it to backward point
Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor,no run,bowled slowly again, he pushes it to  backward point, sets off, but there is no single there, and he gets back just in time
Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor,no run,had the width on this shorter one but slapped it straight to cover

Sathyen: "The difference between good cricketers and great cricketers is in reading the situation. Mayank Agarwal just had to see off Morkel as that over would definitely have been his last for a while. He got away playing an atrocious pull just the previous ball and committed the same blunder again rather than just playing it defensively. Playing international cricket is all about making as little mistakes as possible."
Kallis to Karthik, $$FOUR$$ ,Kallis goes for four first ball, length ball angled in to the pad, and DK tucks it very fine
Kallis to Karthik,no run,leans into a push but it goes off the inner part of the blade for midwicket to make a diving stop
Kallis to Karthik,no run,goes back to a good length, defends it late, down the track
Kallis to Karthik, $$SIX$$ ,Dk's swiped this with a massive top edge off his pad, tall Morne is there at fine leg, but this is too big a task for him as well
Kallis to Karthik,1 run,plays a similar shot, hits it along the ground and straight to Morne this time

Kallis to Taylor, $$OUT$$ ,right through him, Kallis nips this in a mile from just outside off, on a good length, Taylor has moved across and set himself up for a forcing stroke, and there is no way he can account for so much movement, through the gate and into the stumps
Shakib Al Hasan to Karthik,1 run,thumped down to long on
Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy,1 run,skips out to this tossed up ball and eases it to long on
Shakib Al Hasan to Karthik,1 run,opens up and works this through midwicket
Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy,no run,diving stop from Yadav at short extra cover saves some runs
Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy,no run
Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy,2 wides,hurls this full and straight down the leg side to the left-hander
Shakib Al Hasan to Karthik,1 run,whips a full tossed up ball to deep midwicket

rssampat: "It's pretty stupid the way the batsmen run out of the crease for a possible non existent single even when they have hit the ball straight to a close in fielder and then scramble back to regain their crease as the WK is whipping off the bails. It's a pretty pointless exercise which never results in a run, but sometimes does create a run out needlessly. It also wastes the energy of the batsmen"
Kallis to Karthik,no run,goes after a widish one, but under edges it on the bounce to the keeper
Kallis to Karthik,1 leg bye,hit on the thigh pad as he misses a back of a length ball
Kallis to Duminy,1 run,short of a length ball guided to third man
Kallis to Karthik,1 run,eases a pitched up ball down to long on
Kallis to Duminy,1 run,punches a good length ball to extra cover, he has a go at the non-striker's, and misses
Kallis to Karthik,1 run,offcutter runs off the inner part of the bat to long on as DK looks to drive
Chawla to Karthik,1 run,quite short, but there is some turn, and DK cannot get hold of the pull
Chawla to Duminy,no run,goes across the let-hander this wrong one, and JP misses the sweep, had his foot grounded even as the keeper took the bails off
Chawla to Duminy,1 run,punches this one sliding across him to extra cover, DK had backed up too much and would have been gone in case of a direct hit
Chawla to Karthik, $$SIX$$ ,shortish, DK bends, gets under it and hits it high in the air, clears the deep square leg boundary
Chawla to Karthik, $$FOUR$$ ,now the cut, width provided, and DK capitalises with a sharp cut
Chawla to Karthik,1 run
Narine to Karthik,1 run,a top edge loops towards short third man as he tries a reverse paddle
Narine to Duminy,1 run,spins away from the left-hander and is cut to backward point for one
Narine to Karthik,1 run,shortish outside off stump, he cuts it in the air, in the gap at cover and down to the sweeper
Narine to Duminy,no run,stays a touch low, JP misses the cut, and keeper the take
Narine to Duminy,1 run,takes this from outside off and manages a top edge on the slog sweep, it weakly loops and falls in front of deep midwicket
Narine to Karthik,no run,tapped to backward point
Vinay Kumar to Duminy,1 run,that looked dead straight, but umpire Kulkarni spots the inside edge and remains unmoved
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,1 run,widish one cut to the sweeper
Vinay Kumar to Duminy,1 run,tapped behind point for a quick single
Aamir: "Gambhir has done a Misbah here, kept Narine very late which allows Karthik to settle in"
Vinay Kumar to Karthik,1 run,nudged square on the leg side
Vinay Kumar to Duminy, $$FOUR$$ ,scooped fine over the keeper, JP comes across, bends and gets enough bat on this length ball
Vinay Kumar to Duminy,1 run,pushed to mid off for one
Narine to Duminy,no run,beaten on the cut, this was fullish outside off
Narine to Duminy,1 run,swept to deep square leg
Narine to Karthik,1 run,turns in towards the pads and is worked to short fine leg
Narine to Duminy,2 runs,worked in front of square leg and they will come back for the second
Narine to Duminy,1 run,taken from well outside off and worked to deep square leg
Narine to Karthik,2 runs,misfield by Vinay at short third man, DK opened the face and guided this fine, but it should have been stopped really
Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy,1 run,bowls it full and wide, Duminy is eyeing the leg side but he has to hit it down to long off

Shakib Al Hasan to Karthik, $$FOUR$$ ,what a shot, DK's walked out, and his momentum has given this lofted push so much distance, it's almost gone over the deep extra cover rope, it is in the gap anyway and he reaches his 50
Shakib Al Hasan to Karthik,2 runs
Shakib Al Hasan to Karthik,1 run,down the track and eases it to long on
Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy, $$FOUR$$ ,that is right through Morne, it's hit hard down to him at long off, couple of bounces, Morne bends and cups his wrists to stop the ball, but it goes through
Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy,1 run,squeezed into the off side for a single, could have been tight
Narine to Duminy,1 run,tries the reverse sweep, not much on it, but enough for a single wide of short third man
Narine to Karthik,no run,bowled full at the stumps and blocked back calmly
Narine to Karthik, $$OUT$$ ,that's gone, Narine with the breakthrough, DK tries a reverse paddle, misses this big offspinner and is caught in front
Narine to Tiwary, $$FOUR$$ ,outside edge, there is no slip, and these are four fortunate runs, came forward to defend, but this was the one that turns the other way
Narine to Tiwary,1 run
Narine to Duminy,no run,takes a step across and lets this go with the angle, he is expecting a wide call, but is not getting one
Morkel to Tiwary,no run,opens the face to this one climbing around off, finds backward point
Morkel to Tiwary,2 runs,makes room and tries to go over extra cover, toe-ends it over the infield for a couple
Morkel to Tiwary,1 run,short and wide slower one, he mistimes a cut to the sweeper
Morkel to Duminy,no run,tries to dab this length ball to third man but it kicks sharply and beats him

Morkel to Duminy,1 run,he makes plenty of room outside leg, Morne follows him every inch of the way, and hits him with a short of a length ball, it pops up towards point, there is a chance for a run out, but the throw misses
Morkel to Tiwary, $$OUT$$ ,Delhi lose one more, Tiwary slashes this short of a length ball in the air and straight to Narine at third man
Chawla to Neesham,no run,goes back to a pitched up ball and pushes it to extra cover
Chawla to Neesham,no run,a tossed up full ball pushed to extra cover again
Chawla to Neesham,1 run,goes back to a length ball and works it behind square leg
Chawla to Duminy,1 run,tries to go across and pull but cannot get much bat on it, it runs behind square
Chawla to Neesham, $$SIX$$ ,Neesham gets one away, jumps out, reaches this widish one and smashes it high over long off
Chawla to Neesham,no run,he fires the next one in flat at 111.7 kph, it moves away from the left-hander and beats him
Morkel to Duminy,no run,wants to slog this over midwicket but fails to connect to the length ball just outside off
Morkel to Duminy,2 runs,Duminy loses his bat as he reaches out to dab this yorker wide of third man, where old man Kallis throws himself to the ground to save the boundary
Morkel to Duminy, $$FOUR$$ ,JP D finds the boundary this time, clears front leg and lofts this length delivery cleanly over mid off
Morkel to Duminy,1 wide,Morne hands them an extra run with a bouncer down the leg side

Morkel to Duminy, $$SIX$$ ,that's been swiped over deep square leg for six, 138 kph short of a length, just above waist height for the little man, and he attacks it eagerly, as if he was waiting for the length
Morkel to Duminy, $$SIX$$ ,coming apart for Kolkata now, a full toss outside off, JP D walks across and laps it miles over short fine leg, and over the rope too
Morkel to Duminy,2 runs,he tries to go over short fine leg again, but hits this full delivery straight over the keeper instead, Kallis runs around from third man to stop it
Narine to Neesham,no run,no clue about this one as it rips across him to beat a waft
Narine to Neesham,no run,now this one straightens, and almost hits the off stump, missed by inches, Neesham had no idea again
Narine to Neesham,1 run,Neesham trusts the slog sweep and gets to the other end
Narine to Duminy,1 leg bye,tries a reverse sweep, it hits the pad and pops up on the leg side
Narine to Neesham,3 leg byes,Neesham jumps out, it is on the pad and nudged fine, even as slip races after it, they take three
Narine to Duminy,no run,six needed off the last over as Narine beats JP D outside off on the sweep
Gambhir goes for... the legspinner
Chawla to Neesham,no run,a tossed up wrong 'un outside off, and Neesham is beaten
Chawla to Neesham, $$OUT$$ ,this is not over yet, Neesham advances out to a flat one and lifts it straight into the hands of deep midwicket, they cross, and JP D is on strike
Colin: "Gambhir should rename himself 'Gambler'"
Chawla to Duminy, $$SIX$$ ,JP D you beauty, he needs one ball of the four left to finish it, he swings a quick delivery way over the deep backward square leg boundary, that is into the upper tier
That is all for tonight. Good bye

$$JP$$ $$Duminy$$ : "I was not calm on the inside that is for sure. Keep communicating with my partner. You got to target certain bowlers that you fancy yourself to take on. As anyone would know, Narine is not the one you want to take on. Wasn't a plan [to take on Morne]. I was lucky, he is a quality bowler and am sure next time we play he will try to get my head off."

$$Karthik$$ : "When it is 170, you are always behind the asking rate. Being captain you want to show the boys it can be done. One on the board. Let us take it slow. Good start. Boys are pumped up. We have a solid coach who does not get too excited by these things. JP is key to our batting line-up."

$$Gambhir$$ : "Once you get 165 on any kind of wicket you feel you are in with a chance with the kind of attack we have. JP played an unbelievable innings. Apparently there was some dew, gets difficult for the spinners when there is some dew."
Came down to that one expensive Morne over, when Delhi were threatening to let it slip away after DK's rather needless dismissal. JP Duminy was the man for the night

name: Kolkata Knight Riders v Delhi Daredevils
